Falters at times: The expert, Michael Sheedy, falters in providing evidence to support his claim. He initially claims that fewer people enter into marriage in jurisdictions with domestic partnerships but later admits that he could not find any data or examples to support this claim.
Understate: The claim may understate the potential impact of domestic partnerships on the institution of marriage. Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the expert, Michael Sheedy, could not provide any concrete examples or data to support his statement. This lack of evidence contradicts the claim that fewer people enter into marriage in jurisdictions where domestic partnerships are enacted.
